context.intro: Lithium-ion batteries (UN 3480/3481) are critical components for backup power and solar systems but are classified as Class 9 Dangerous Goods. Importing them requires strict adherence to IATA and IMDG packing instructions.
shippingTips: Ensure MSDS is under 2 years old.
Verify UN38.3 test summary is available.
Check if battery is packed with equipment (UN3481) or standalone (UN3480).

faqs.question: What is the import duty on Lithium Batteries?
faqs.answer: As of 2026, Lithium-ion accumulators (HS 8507.60) generally attract a 15% duty rate in South Africa, plus 15% VAT.

faqs.question: Do I need an NRCS Letter of Authority (LOA)?
faqs.answer: Yes, lithium batteries often fall under compulsory specifications for safety and require an NRCS LOA before customs release.

faqs.question: Can I air freight lithium batteries?
faqs.answer: Yes, but strictly regulated. They must be declared as Dangerous Goods (Cargo Aircraft Only for bulk) and packed by certified personnel.
